net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal

Class ModalFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.modal.ModalFactory

  • public class ModalFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    An instanced factory class. Contains the code to create various modal dialogs. Most creation methods will also decorate the dialog. This class is primarily intended for use by the ModalManager, but may also be used wherever else when a feature-enriched modal dialog is desired.

    • Method Detail

      • newFactory

        public static ModalFactory newFactory()
        Create a ModalFactory for usage. Sure, you could just use the constructor. But this is a factory after all.
        Returns:
        A ModalFactory to create dialogs

      • createMessageDialog

        public MessageDialog createMessageDialog(Element parent,
                                         java.lang.String message)
        Create a message dialog meant to be placed in the center of the given element. (The location will be centered based on the element's width and height) Nothing extra will be added, a dialog will just be created.
        Parameters:
        parent - The element which will contain this dialog
        message - The message to show on the dialog
        Returns:
        A MessageDialog centered in the parent, with the given message

      • createConfirmationDialog

        public ConfirmationDialog createConfirmationDialog(Element parent,
                                                   java.lang.String prompt)
        Create a confirmation dialog meant to be placed in the center of the given element. (The location will be centered based on the element's width and height) Nothing extra will be added, a dialog will just be created.
        Parameters:
        parent - The element which will contain this dialog
        prompt - The message to show on the dialog
        Returns:
        A ConfirmationDialog centered in the parent, with the given message

      • createInputDialog

        public InputDialog createInputDialog(Element parent,
                                     java.lang.String prompt)
        Create an input dialog meant to be placed in the center of the given element. (The location will be centered based on the element's width and height) Nothing extra will be added, a dialog will just be created.
        Parameters:
        parent - The element which will contain this dialog
        prompt - The message to show on the dialog
        Returns:
        An InputDialog centered in the parent, with the given message

      • createInputDialog

        public InputDialog createInputDialog(Element parent,
                                     java.lang.String prompt,
                                     InputValidator<java.lang.String> inputValidator)
        Create an input dialog meant to be placed in the center of the given element. (The location will be centered based on the element's width and height) Nothing extra will be added, a dialog will just be created.
        Parameters:
        parent - The element which will contain this dialog
        prompt - The message to show on the dialog
        inputValidator - An object to make sure the dialog returns only valid input
        Returns:
        An InputDialog centered in the parent, with the given message
